alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 10:49AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River Above Carlin affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and slowly increase river flows. An active and wet pattern today and though the midweek could result in a rapid increase in levels and flows along the Humboldt River. For the Upper Humboldt...including Carlin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River Above Carlin. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tomorrow after 1000 AM PDT.
